column4: I have an ATI remote wonder hooked up to this machine.  Randomly the machine will hang during boot when usb.rc tries to initialize the remote.  What can I send you to help debug it?
you're using the driver from gatos.sourceforge.net?
or is there one in 2.6 new?
ya, whatever is there by default
it moved the mouse when it doesn't hang the boot
hangs maybe one out of 3 or 4 boots
I have a box with one of those remotes, but it's on 2.4 using ati_remote from gatos
it also needs lirc, which is why it isn't running 2.6 yet
nothing on the console when it hangs?
probably best would be to get a task dump using magic sysrq
I'll try that....are logs from previous boots stored anywhere?  my only option when the boot hangs is to power cycle....unless magic sysrq works, I forgot about that actually
and there is data on the console when it hangs....I've seen I think two versions of the hang....but it happens in approximately the same place each time
oh and congrats to all the devs on a nice package....best gnome distro I've seen yet
the trouble with magic sysrq is that you'll need to write down the data by hand, unless you have a serial console setup
if there are messages on the console when it hangs, those would help
good idea, if you can read the text
anyway, if you can get some hard data about the hang, file a bug
